title._content: ["Willowbank," Joseph Coleman Bright house, 624 Morris Avenue, Bryn Mawr, Pennsylvania. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Willowbank," Joseph Coleman Bright house, 624 Morris Avenue, Bryn Mawr, Pennsylvania. Arbor in rose garden] [1919 spring] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: John Irwin Bright. Landscape: Anna Linn Bright, 1911. Today: House extant. On slide (handwritten): "Bright" and no. "192." Also, blind embossed stamp: "Frances B. Johnston, New York." Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Subjects: Gardens--Pennsylvania--Bryn Mawr--1920-1930. Arbors (Bowers)--Pennsylvania--Bryn Mawr--1920-1930. Roses--Pennsylvania--Bryn Mawr--1920-1930. Fountains--Pennsylvania--Bryn Mawr--1920-1930. Format: Lantern slides--Hand-colored--1920-1930. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16249 Call Number: LC-J717-X100- 40
